p: Although there were previous studies on the essential oils from H. brasiliense leaves, none of them discriminated among male and female plants [ 18, 19, 28] and, to the best of our knowledge, this is the first report with flower essential oils. In our study, the essential oil yields were similar for flowers and leaves of H. brasiliense, with the male flowers presenting the lowest oil amounts. Regarding the leaf oil contents, the results were like those found for a Paraná State specimen (Brazil) [ 28], collected in an area not far from Ilha do Cardoso (São Paulo State, Brazil). However, these values were lower than those found for a specimen collected in Santa Catarina State (Brazil), whose leaves yielded 0.5% ( v/ w) [ 19], but this place is further south from our collection site.
